properties.name: builtIn
properties.description: Gets a value that indicates whether the CustomXmlPart is built-in.

examples.description: Check if a custom XML part is built-in and log the result to the console

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access a custom XML part's request context to verify the connection to the Office host application before performing operations on the XML part.

properties.name: documentElement
properties.description: Gets the root element of a bound region of data in the document. If the region is empty, the property returns Nothing.

examples.description: Get and display the tag name of the root element from a custom XML part in the document.

properties.name: errors
properties.description: Gets a CustomXmlValidationErrorCollection object that provides access to any XML validation errors.

examples.description: Check if a custom XML part has any validation errors and log the error count to the console.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Gets the ID of the custom XML part.

examples.description: Add a custom XML part containing reviewer names to the document and store its ID in the document settings for later retrieval.

properties.name: namespaceManager
properties.description: Gets the set of namespace prefix mappings used against the current CustomXmlPart object.

examples.description: Get all namespace prefix mappings from a custom XML part and log them to the console to understand what XML namespaces are defined in the document.

properties.name: namespaceUri
properties.description: Gets the namespace URI of the custom XML part.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the namespace URI from a custom XML part that was previously stored in the document settings.

properties.name: schemaCollection
properties.description: Specifies a CustomXmlSchemaCollection object representing the set of schemas attached to a bound region of data in the document.

examples.description: Get the number of schemas attached to a custom XML part and log the namespace of the first schema in the collection.

properties.name: xml
properties.description: Gets the XML representation of the current CustomXmlPart object.

examples.description: Read and display the XML content from the first custom XML part in the document

methods.name: addNode
methods.description: Adds a node to the XML tree.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent node to which the new node will be added.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. The options that define the node to be added.

examples.description: Add a new customer element with name and email child nodes to an existing custom XML part in the document
Delete a custom XML part from a Word document by retrieving its ID from settings, removing the XML part, verifying deletion, and cleaning up the associated setting.

methods.name: deleteAttribute
methods.description: Deletes an attribute with the given name from the element identified by xpath.

params.name: xpath
params.description: Absolute path to the single element in XPath notation.

params.name: namespaceMappings
params.description: An object whose property values are namespace names and whose property names are aliases for the corresponding namespaces. For example, `{greg: "http://calendartypes.org/xsds/GregorianCalendar"}`. The property names (such as "greg") can be any string that doesn't used reserved XPath characters, such as the forward slash "/".

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the attribute.

examples.description: Delete the "status" attribute from a "document" element in a custom XML part that uses a namespace

methods.name: deleteElement
methods.description: Deletes the element identified by xpath.

params.name: xpath
params.description: Absolute path to the single element in XPath notation.

params.name: namespaceMappings
params.description: An object whose property values are namespace names and whose property names are aliases for the corresponding namespaces. For example, `{greg: "http://calendartypes.org/xsds/GregorianCalendar"}`. The property names (such as "greg") can be any string that doesn't used reserved XPath characters, such as the forward slash "/".

examples.description: Delete a specific customer element from a custom XML part using its ID xpath

methods.name: getXml
methods.description: Gets the full XML content of the custom XML part.

examples.description: Add a custom XML part to the Word document, retrieve its XML content, and store its ID in document settings for later access.

methods.name: insertAttribute
methods.description: Inserts an attribute with the given name and value to the element identified by xpath.

params.name: xpath
params.description: Absolute path to the single element in XPath notation.

params.name: namespaceMappings
params.description: An object whose property values are namespace names and whose property names are aliases for the corresponding namespaces. For example, `{greg: "http://calendartypes.org/xsds/GregorianCalendar"}`. The property names (such as "greg") can be any string that doesn't used reserved XPath characters, such as the forward slash "/".

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the attribute.

params.name: value
params.description: Value of the attribute.

examples.description: Add a "Nation" attribute with value "US" to the root element of a custom XML part stored in the Word document, using XPath to locate the target element.

methods.name: insertElement
methods.description: Inserts the given XML under the parent element identified by xpath at child position index.

params.name: xpath
params.description: Absolute path to the single parent element in XPath notation.

params.name: xml
params.description: XML content to be inserted.

params.name: namespaceMappings
params.description: An object whose property values are namespace names and whose property names are aliases for the corresponding namespaces. For example, `{greg: "http://calendartypes.org/xsds/GregorianCalendar"}`. The property names (such as "greg") can be any string that doesn't used reserved XPath characters, such as the forward slash "/".

params.name: index
params.description: Zero-based position at which the new XML to be inserted. If omitted, the XML will be appended as the last child of this parent.

examples.description: Insert a new XML element at a specified position within a custom XML part stored in a Word document, using XPath to locate the parent element.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the namespace URI of a custom XML part in a Word document

methods.name: loadXml
methods.description: Populates the CustomXmlPart object from an XML string.

params.name: xml
params.description: The XML string to load.

examples.description: Replace the XML content of an existing custom XML part with new product catalog data

methods.name: query
methods.description: Queries the XML content of the custom XML part.

params.name: xpath
params.description: An XPath query.

params.name: namespaceMappings
params.description: An object whose property values are namespace names and whose property names are aliases for the corresponding namespaces. For example, `{greg: "http://calendartypes.org/xsds/GregorianCalendar"}`. The property names (such as "greg") can be any string that doesn't used reserved XPath characters, such as the forward slash "/".

returns.description: An array where each item represents an entry matched by the XPath query.

examples.description: Query a custom XML part in a Word document using XPath expressions to find matching elements, with support for both namespaced and non-namespaced XML.

methods.name: selectNodes
methods.description: Selects a collection of nodes from a custom XML part.

params.name: xPath
params.description: The XPath expression to evaluate.

examples.description: Select all employee nodes from a custom XML part where the department is "Engineering" and log their count to the console.

methods.name: selectSingleNode
methods.description: Selects a single node within a custom XML part matching an XPath expression.

params.name: xPath
params.description: The XPath expression to evaluate.

examples.description: Select and retrieve the text content of a specific employee node from a custom XML part using an XPath expression to find the employee with ID "E001"

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Update multiple properties of a custom XML part by setting its namespace URI and ID at the same time

methods.name: setXml
methods.description: Sets the full XML content of the custom XML part.

params.name: xml
params.description: XML content to be set.

examples.description: Replace an existing custom XML part in a Word document with new XML content containing a different set of reviewers.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.CustomXmlPart object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.CustomXmlPartData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Retrieve a custom XML part and serialize it to JSON format for logging or external storage purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension.clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a custom XML part object across multiple sync calls to prevent "InvalidObjectPath" errors when accessing its properties after synchronization.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension.clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Add a custom XML part to the document, use it to store data, then untrack it to release memory after the operation is complete.

methods.name: updateAttribute
methods.description: Updates the value of an attribute with the given name of the element identified by xpath.

params.name: xpath
params.description: Absolute path to the single element in XPath notation.

params.name: namespaceMappings
params.description: An object whose property values are namespace names and whose property names are aliases for the corresponding namespaces. For example, `{greg: "http://calendartypes.org/xsds/GregorianCalendar"}`. The property names (such as "greg") can be any string that doesn't used reserved XPath characters, such as the forward slash "/".

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the attribute.

params.name: value
params.description: New value of the attribute.

examples.description: Update the author attribute of a book element in a custom XML part to change the author name from "John Smith" to "Jane Doe"

methods.name: updateElement
methods.description: Updates the XML of the element identified by xpath.

params.name: xpath
params.description: Absolute path to the single element in XPath notation.

params.name: xml
params.description: New XML content to be stored.

params.name: namespaceMappings
params.description: An object whose property values are namespace names and whose property names are aliases for the corresponding namespaces. For example, `{greg: "http://calendartypes.org/xsds/GregorianCalendar"}`. The property names (such as "greg") can be any string that doesn't used reserved XPath characters, such as the forward slash "/".

examples.description: Update a customer's email address in a custom XML part by finding the customer element with a specific ID and replacing the email value
